page.title: 11School Then and Now.
page.content: we looked at the old log books & found that children were often away with scarlet fever, whooping cough or measles or were kept at home to help with harvesting, bird-scaring or stone picking. In 1894 one boy actually died at school but we do not know why. NOW we come in at 9.am. after playing in the yard. We have the register and then Assembly, which is usually about something like picking rubbish up or the Ethiopian famine. Then we go to our classes. We do maths. I am doing grouping in 4's and 5's with unifix cubes. We write stories or do spellings and we do science. We did some experiments about which soil grew seeds best and which holds most water. At play we go in the yard or the back garden. There are trees and bushes to play around and I like the climbing frame. It is good fun.
